"Loneliness, however, has nothing to do with being alone, as many human beings confuse and misunderstand. Loneliness is a state of being alone for oneself, in which a human being is alone because he wants to be alone or has to be alone. Loneliness, on the other hand, is based on the fact that human beings have thoughts and feelings that make them separate them from all external influences, make them feel alone and abandoned and do not cultivate any connecting contacts with their fellow human beings. Depending on the thoughts and feelings, one human being feels lonely more often and more quickly than another, whereby acceptance and imitation also play a very important role. Especially very sensitive human beings feel lonely very quickly, often because they feel misunderstood by others and feel that they have been treated wrongly and trivially. This leads them to isolate themselves from the environment and to go away in cloudy, evil thoughts and feelings, which of course promotes their state of loneliness even more. But not enough with that, because even if it sounds paradoxical, the radiated loneliness acts like a poisonous virus on the fellow men, consequently the whole thing is transferred to them. And the worst thing about it is that it is precisely where the interpersonal contacts are very close, such as in the family, in the circle of friends and acquaintances or in a smaller or larger group of human beings, that the symptoms of loneliness are expressed very strongly and have a contagious effect. As a result, loneliness can spread within a group or in society like a nasty ulcer. For as soon as a human being feels lonely within a family, circle of friends or acquaintances, or in a smaller or larger group, the risk increases that others will also slowly but surely begin to feel lonely, with the risk of others being infected being over 50 percent. The whole thing creates a kind of cycle of isolation, and when a human being feels lonely, he inevitably behaves negatively towards others. This usually leads to a situation where, if there is not an infection, the other people turn away from the lonely human beings, whereby those who turn away are naturally disappointed, but this has the negative effect that they then unconsciously begin to avoid the lonely human being and treat him unfairly. In this way many friendships break up, not only direct contacts, but gradually the whole social network is infected by it and falls into bad ways."                                                                                            Semjase Silver Star Centre, 29th May 2010, 'Billy' Eduard Albert Meier (BEAM)

PLEASE READ THIS IMPORTANT MESSAGE:

Loneliness has become an epidemic. While surrounded by a crowd, we somehow still feel alone and isolated. Loneliness can have very bad effects on mental and physical health if you feel lonely for a long time, and that is not good, so I had an idea:

Let's make anti loneliness chains a thing. It may not do much, and may not cure loneliness, but words are powerful and if used a positive way, can make someone's day brighter.

Here is how to share the happiness, I will start:

Hi, my name is jt. You don't know me, I don't know you, but I would just like to say you are an amazing, beautiful human being and I sincerely hope you accomplish every one of your dreams. As much as I would like to, I cannot make your problems go away. However please know that you are strong and I believe that you can overcome any obstacle if you try your hardest.

We will likely never cross paths, but I hope that you find close friends who respect and care for you, love that will never leave your side, and that you fulfill all your aspirations

Sincerely, jt.

Now, it is your turn.

Reply to the last person on this chain, write them any kind words and compliments that you wish, and share a little dose of happy with someone who may need it. It can't cure sadness or loneliness, but words are extremely powerful and if used positively may put a smile on someone's face.

:D strictly a no hate thread, the world has enough of that already.

Please, pass along this message wherever it is fitting. We need to make kindness a THING. Your words could be the reason someone decides to live on for another day, to get up the next time they stumble, to keep on trying when they have given up hope

As much as I love being alone, I hate being lonely.
I used to have a life that I never took the time to enjoy while I could, seeing as I was young. Really young and still am young.
I had tons of friends, really close by family who I loved deeply, a loving home and neighborhood and good grades. I was happy. But my parents would sometimes fight at night, at times my mom would wake me and my sister up at like 3 am to drive us to my dad apartment where he only sleeps for work since his work is very far from home so he had to stay in an apartment at times with his roommate. And those moments scar me. I never liked fighting, yelling. It always scared me and still does.
It was bad enough to the point where my mom told me we were moving, I thought we were moving to a new house which I was kinda sad but ok with. But she told me we were moving to japan which is pretty much on the other side of the country to where I lived which was in Florida. I was broken, I couldn’t talk to my mom I didn’t want to.
I had only about 3 weeks until moving so I spend 1 full week with my best friend who is a sister to me, and the other 2 weeks with my cousins. I never got to say a proper goodbye to them because I left at night when they were all sleeping.

I’ve been living in japan for 3 years now almost 4, and although everyone here is nice to me. No one really talks or hangs out with me. I’m always by myself, everyday. And it’s painful. I pray one day one friend who I can actually talk to will come along, I have internet friends and I desperately want to meet them. Being lonely isn’t fun, some people joke about it. And I laugh sometimes, only because I laugh at my problems.
My mom doesn’t seem to notice how much moving changed me in such a bad way, she never cared though. My mom doesn’t admit it but I know she likes my sister over me, but that’s fine. I know I’m my dads favorite. I’ll be moving to a new house soon because I’m living with my grandparents, and my grandma is abusive, emotionally.
She makes fun of my appearance especially my nose, and I became insecure and now have terrible low self esteem, and self conscious. I wear a mask over my mouth and nose to cover half of my face when going to school or anywhere in public and try avoiding going anywhere outside.

I have an option to move in with my dad though, and as much as I want too.. I’m now scared, my mom pretty much blackmailed me into not going, giving reasons as to why I shouldn’t go. And I believed them, and as much as I don’t want too I can’t help it.
I do think if I had a friend to help me through this even one I might have some confidence in me to make my own choices, but I don’t have friends, not a family to support me.
Doing this alone isn’t easy, being lonely hurts. And I know some people deal with worst than what I’ve been through, but I can’t really say much besides.
Don’t give up, even when you want too. You’re standing strong right now so don’t throw that away. You will find the path you’re looking for you just have to stay strong, I’m hoping to find that light for myself as well.

I don't see how individualism affect loneliness. Individualism is about having a primary focus on bettering oneself, which ultimately leads to being a better member of society (which doesn't exclude people from social interactions, in fact it can improve someone's capability of interacting with others), and it's also about treating others as individuals rather than parts of a group (which prevent someone to fall into traps like racism or identity politics in general, which obviously has the effect of being better at relating with others).

Relying too much on technology on the other end can contribute a lot to loneliness, not for lack of contact but rather for the quality of contact. Meeting people IRL is not even comparable with chatting to the same person, it removes things like body language, eye to eye contact, conveying emotions, body contact and so on. Take a typical YouTube comment section for example, people are quick to aggressiveness and insults, which are things that IRL they wouldn't do unless really pushed to the extreme.

This is true! I used to work during the night shift, 10pm-6am. The night shift only required ONE staff on the floor so was ALONE for 8hrs every night, for 5 nights a week. I'd get home at half past 6am and my family would still be sleeping. I'll eat something and go to sleep. When I wake up my family would be gone to work or school and i'd be all alone the whole day. I'll take a nap at 6pm before my family got home and be up by 9pm to go to work. This continued for months and I didn't realize it then, but looking back on it I was sooo incredibly lonely. I remember I used to get SO happy to see another staff member come on at 6am for shift change but right when I left and was alone again I'd get this really sad feeling, I can't explain it :( I had limited contact with my family and friends and though I had weekends off, my sleep schedule was the complete opposite of everyone else's so I was always sleepy and not really there at the moment. Its so weird, but I completely understand how prison inmates who are in solid confinement go crazy after a while.

I left my job a few months back and my sleep patterns has never been the same but social contact has made me feel soooooo much better and healthier! Loneliness is real!
